xhtml:body.xhtml:p: Measures the time interval between two electrical events on a single electrical signal where the signal's voltage level crosses a trigger level with the same transitioning direction.
Parameter nominal is the nominal value of the time inteval
Parameter low_level is the loweset allowable absolute voltage in the signal
Parameter high_level is the highest allowable absolute voltage in the signal
Parameter trigger_level is the voltage level for triggering
Parameter trigger_slope is the transitioning direction for triggering
Implements the ProcessType "Measure.Time.Interval.SingleChannel.LevelCrossing.Electronic" using a HP 54124T (50 GHz Digitizing Oscilloscope)
Below 1.4 ns time intervals the CMC uncertainty is a constant value.
Above 1.4 ns time intervals the CMC uncertainty a function of the time interval.
Implements the ProcessType "Measure.Time.Interval.SingleChannel.LevelCrossing.Electronic" using a HP 5334B (counter) with an external time base
1) Connect the time base output to the counter's 10 MHz input.
2) Set the counter's Channel A input to 50 ohms.
2) Connect the DUT the counter's Channel A input.
3) Set the counter's Function to Period A.
1) Set the counter's Slope, Gate Time, Sample Rate, Input Coupling and ATTEN controls to appropriate values
3) Record time interval value displayed on counter.
The CMC uncertainty is based on the uncertainty of the time base. It is a constant fixed value of 2.9 ns.
